intro: Eleocharis salzmanniana, commonly known as the salt marsh sedge, is a flowering plant species native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. This plant typically grows in brackish or saline wetlands, where it thrives in conditions of high salinity and fluctuating water levels. Its morphology includes grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that are adapted to its aquatic or semi-aquatic habitat. Eleocharis salzmanniana plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various wetland organisms.
